alert.note: Alert for Apache Junction, Gold Canyon; Fountain Hills, East Mesa; Mazatzal Mountains; Northwest Pinal County; Pinal, Superstition Mountains; Rio Verde, Salt River; Superior; Tonto Basin (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 1:47PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Gila, Maricopa and Pinal Counties through 230 PM MST... At 147 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Four Peaks to 8 miles northeast of Florence. These storms were nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Apache Junction, Florence, Superior, Gold Canyon, Sugarloaf Mountain, Ballantine Trailhead, Roosevelt, Round Valley, Sunflower, Gold Camp, Roosevelt Dam, Lost Dutchman State Park, Goldfield, Top-Of-The-World, Florence Junction, Queen Valley, Canyon Lake, Superstition Mountains, Tonto National Monument and Four Peaks. This includes the following highways... US Highway 60 between mile markers 196 and 240. AZ Route 87 between mile markers 199 and 227. AZ Route 79 between mile markers 130 and 150. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Apache Junction, Gold Canyon; Fountain Hills, East Mesa; Mazatzal Mountains; Northwest Pinal County; Pinal, Superstition Mountains; Rio Verde, Salt River; Superior; Tonto Basin
